Package suga.engine.input.keyboard

Class StackGameKeyListener

java.lang.Object
suga.engine.input.keyboard.StackGameKeyListener
All Implemented Interfaces:
KeyListener, EventListener, GameKeyListener
public class StackGameKeyListener extends Object implements GameKeyListener
The StackGameKeyListener creates a stack of pressed, and depressed events which are then accessed with accessor methods to be read by the game.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    protected Collection<KeyValue>
    heldKeys
    A collection of keys that are currently being held.
    protected Stack<KeyValue>

    keysReleased
    A stack of keys that have been depressed and need to be handled by the game.
    protected KeyMapper
    mapper
    The KeyMapper being used by this listener.

  • Constructor Details

    • StackGameKeyListener

      public StackGameKeyListener()
      Creates a new StackGameKeyListener without binding it to a frame. Uses the BasicKeyMapper by default.

    • StackGameKeyListener

      public StackGameKeyListener(BasicKeyMapper mapper)
      Creates a new StackGameKeyListener without binding it to a frame.
      Parameters:
      mapper - The KeyMapper to be used by this KeyListener.

    • StackGameKeyListener

      public StackGameKeyListener(JFrame frame)
      Creates a new StackGameKeyListener for use in the given frame. Uses the BasicKeyMapper by default.
      Parameters:
      frame - The JFrame that this KeyListener is using.

    • StackGameKeyListener

      public StackGameKeyListener(JFrame frame, KeyMapper mapper)
      Creates a new StackGameKeyListener for use in the given frame.
      Parameters:
      frame - The JFrame that this KeyListener is using.
      mapper - The KeyMapper to be used by this KeyListener.

    • getKeysPressed

      @Deprecated public Stack<Integer> getKeysPressed()
      Deprecated.
      Accessor method for the stack of keys that has been pressed. Should be used by games to read key presses.
      Returns:
      The stack of keys that have been pressed.

      Deprecated.
      Accessor method for the stack of keys that have been depressed. Should be used by games to read key presses.
      Returns:
      The stack of keys that have been depressed.

      public boolean isHeld(KeyValue key)

      Specified by:
      isHeld in interface GameKeyListener
      Parameters:
      key - The key to check if it's being held or not.
      Returns:
      True if the key is currently being held, otherwise false.

    • getKeyPresses

      public Stack<KeyValue> getKeyPresses()
      Returns a stack of key presses that have not yet been handled.
      Specified by:
      getKeyPresses in interface GameKeyListener
      Returns:
      The 'to handle' stack of key presses.

      Returns:
      The 'to handle' stack of key releases.

    • setFrame

      public void setFrame(JFrame frame)

      Parameters:
